forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 57. West southwest wind around 6 mph.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 67, with temperatures falling to around 64 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 5 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph.

weather_report:
As dawn gently breaks over Downtown San Francisco, the early hours are enveloped in a soft, gauzy embrace of clouds, promising a day that will slowly awaken to clarity. The air is mild, lingering around the comfortable 57 degrees, a whisper of coolness carried by a light west-southwest breeze. With the sun poised to rise, the forecast suggests a delightful transition into the day. Morning shadows will gradually yield to a mostly sunny disposition, though, like an old friend, the cool fog may briefly linger, especially near the iconic bridge and coastline.

As the afternoon unfolds, expect temperatures to settle around 64 degrees, creating a canvas perfect for leisurely strolls along the waterfront or perhaps a quiet afternoon in one of the local cafés, where the scent of freshly brewed coffee dances in the air. Considering the breeze that may gust to 20 mph, layers will serve best today—think light sweaters or jackets to ward off the chill, particularly if your adventures lead you toward the sea. Indulge in simple pleasures: a visit to a bookstore, perusing the latest novels, or perhaps a quiet moment in one of the city’s many parks, fragrant with late summer blooms—this day, while subtle, holds the promise of serene beauty beneath its soft clouds.
